comment.body:
@Yuki2718 Sorry, can you take a look? Looks like most of these are self-promotion? I checked on

```
https://xissmie.xfolio.jp/@totyuu89
https://nijimiss.moe/@Seunun
```

and the links of the banners are

```
https://xfolio.jp/en/portfolio/blic
https://subscription.nijimiss.app/
https://forum.nijimiss.org/
```

---

Oh, this one is indeed ads: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/221114

Maybe each site needs a separate scriptlet and exclude by the target URL, but I'm not sure if `json-prune` has that capability or not.

issue.body:
### Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue - [x] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue - [x] I checked the [knowledge base](https://adguard.com/kb/) and found no answer - [x] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed ### AdGuard version 8.0.5231.0 ### Browser version naver whale,4.34.340.19(official build)(64bit) ### OS version window 11 ### Traffic filtering - [x] yes, I do ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter ### Privacy _No response_ ### Social _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### Language-specific List-KR ### Which DNS server do you use? DNS protection disabled ### DNS protocol None ### Custom DNS _No response_ ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Support ticket ID _No response_ ### Issue Details Steps to reproduce: 1. 2. 3. ### Expected Behavior hide add ### Actual Behavior change ad into http error the white rectangle with http error on right is ad page In addition to the errors shown in the picture, various security-series http errors are displayed randomly. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1
### Additional Information _No response_

issue.title: data.orders.costco.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [https://data.orders.costco.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdata.orders.costco.com)
### Comment
> A few days after placing a order to have furniture delivered from Costco, I received an email with links to select my delivery time window, or to view/cancel/reschedule the order. These links route through https://data.orders.costco.com which then redirects to https://logistics.costco.com. These are actual, relevant and useful links to me as a Costco customer, and although they perform tracking, are the primary way the business is reaching out to me about this issue. The "View in browser" link on the email also goes to https://data.orders.costco.com and is broken by AdGuard DNS. Thank you!
```
Username: @jriesen
```

### Screenshots
<details>
  <summary>Screenshot 1 </summary>

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/gchveegnqjccoco4w0kk4s04kwg48kwrxa2q3iuyn4.png?nc=1)

</details>

Information | Value

comment.body:
I meant it's better to check on the website, not the saved page.
According to the script, removing it also should help. I think one of these rules can be added if it helps.
```adblock
parivahansewa.live#%#//scriptlet('remove-node-text', 'script', 'pop_done')

```

comment.body:
The directive is not needed. You can use the hint instead of the rules or these ones below.
